page.title: 05Fletton land reclamation 1
page.content: The Land Reclamation Centre (L.R.C.) is to be found just off the A 15. In a convenient programme of cooperation with the London Brick Company the L.R.C. deals with the problem of getting rid of the ash, an unwanted by-product, which is left over during the process of producing electricity from coal at the power stations of Drakelow, Ratcliffe and West Burton. The Central Electrity generating board, who entirely run the L.R.C. in our area, organise the ash disposal system in the followimg way:_ The L.B.C have for many years been digging pits in our area to excavate the Oxford clay which is used to manufacture bricks. When a pit has been exhausted it is then loaned to the C.E.G.B so that it can be re-filled, using the ash from the power stations.
